definition[0]: the feeling of always being tired because you have been working too hard
example[0]: Many of the teachers are suffering from burnout.
definition[1]: the time when a rocket or jet has finished all of its fuel and stops operating
definition[2]: a feeling of extreme tiredness and lack of energy caused by working too hard
example[1]: With longer vacations you would see less burnout and higher productivity.
definition[3]: when people stop doing something because they are tired of doing it or feel they have been asked to do it too much
example[2]: Donor burnout grows as requests for money increase and fewer people can afford to give.
